intro: Helosciadium trifoliatum, commonly known as the three-leaved helosciadium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of Europe and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
